Submit Abstract Register

title: AIEPS Day 2026
text:
Overview
AIEPS Day 2026 will bring together researchers, practitioners, and students at the intersection of AI and Earth & Planetary Sciences. Building on the success of the 2025 workshop, it will feature invited talks, contributed presentations, hands-on exercises, and networking.

May 28: Hands-on exercises
May 29: Full-day talks
Format: Onsite; selected keynotes available online

title: AIEPS Day 2026
text:
Topics

Physics-informed neural networks & hybrid approaches
AI for geophysical modeling, inversion & uncertainty quantification
Deep learning for satellite/aerial imagery
AI in planetary exploration & data analysis
Predictive modeling for natural hazards
Automated mineral identification & geological mapping
AI for ocean, atmospheric & climate modeling
LLMs in geoscience research

title: AIEPS Day 2026
text:
Code of Conduct
All participants are expected to maintain a respectful, inclusive, and harassment-free environment. We welcome everyone regardless of background, identity, or experience level.

Be respectful and considerate
Refrain from discriminatory or harassing behavior
Alert organisers if you notice violations

title: AIEPS Seminars
text:
Previous Talks





#0 Solving some amazing problem with AI in solid earth geophysics


Dr.¬†XYZ, ABC Institute ¬∑ 12 Dec 2025


‚ñº



This seminar presented recent advances in applying deep learning techniques to satellite imagery for environmental monitoring. Topics included CNN architectures for multi-spectral data, transfer learning for limited labeled datasets, and case studies in land cover classification and change detection.

title: AIEPS Seminars
text:
How to Attend
Seminars are held online and open to all. Details on registration and access links will be posted ahead of each talk.

title: AI in Earth & Planetary Science
text:
AI in Earth & Planetary Science
A special interest group of researchers at the intersection of Earth & planetary science and AI & machine learning research and applications.


Browse upcoming events under Workshops and Seminars.
This special interest group brings together geoscience, planetary science, machine learning, computer science, and AI‚Äîso AI research can benefit from domain knowledge, and geoscientists can track and apply relevant AI advances.
We focus on combining geoscience and AI without compromising scientific rigor, while staying open to new technologies as they mature. ChatGPT, Copilot, and LLMs are not the primary focus of AIEPS; however, we expect to occasionally develop and monitor practical guidelines for using LLMs responsibly.

Supported by

title: AIEPS Day 2025
text:
Past Event


Workshop on AI in Earth & Planetary Sciences

üìÖ 27 May 2025 üìç GTK, Espoo, Finland üîó Hybrid

title: AIEPS Day 2025
text:
Overview
AIEPS 2025 was a full-day hybrid event hosted by the Geological Survey of Finland (GTK) and co-organized with the SEG Distinguished Instructor Short Course (DISC).
The workshop explored emerging trends in AI, machine learning, and scientific computing applied to Earth and planetary systems ‚Äî coinciding with the visit of Prof.¬†Mrinal K. Sen (UT Austin) under the MULTIVERSE project funded by the Research Council of Finland.

Venue: GTK, Vuorimiehentie 5, Espoo, Finland
Format: Hybrid (In-person + Online)
Co-host: SEG DISC, Society of Exploration Geophysicists
Supported by: MULTIVERSE Project, Research Council of Finland
